abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Programmatic Financial and
            Public Sector Adjustment Loan Project aims at supporting
            reforms in the public sector, in response primarily to the
            financial crisis of February 2001, and, ensure as well
            continued social programs through adequate funding. To this
            end, the project will examine, and help the government amend
            as needed the banking regulatory framework, including
            strengthening of the new Bank Regulation and Supervision
            Agency (BRSA), and, restructuring/privatization of state
            banks. Regulation regarding banking failure resolution and
            problem banks, will be institutionally strengthened, through
            a process of aligning prudential banking systems, to reduce
            banking vulnerability, withstand external shocks (thereby
            reduce systemic failure risk), to position Turkey's
            banking sector for accession to the European Union (EU), in
            accordance with applicable EU banking sector directives.
            Furthermore, structural fiscal adjustment policies will be
            supported, to achieve macroeconomic stability, and ensure
            the protection of public social spending. The
            Government's public expenditure management reform
            program will be broadened, which includes improvements to
            budget planning, financial accountability, and public
            liability management, as well as initial steps for civil
            service reforms. However, the politically sensitive public
            sector reform agenda may be jeopardized by vested interest
            groups, while capacity constraints are also risks that may
            hinder the pace of envisaged reforms.
